page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO WINGERWORTH
page.content: { Wingerworth}has developed from a village of 1473 inhabitants in 1951 to a dormitory settlement of over 6200 in 1984. 80% of the housing has been built since 1945. It is a picturesque village surrounded by farm and woodland, much of which is under preservation order. The residents take a pride in its appearance, winning the 'Best Kept Large Village' competition several times. There are a large number of leisure facilities provided, including open play areas, woodland and the 'main attraction', The Lido, a large pond which is ecologically important. The only main industry in the village is the NCB. Avenue Coking Plant and Bole Hill Quarry. Most of the inhabitants go to Chesterfield or Clay Cross to work.
